1.text: I am a rose of Sharon, a lily of the valley.

2.text: Like a lily among the thorns is my darling among the maidens.

3.text: Like an apple tree among the trees of the forest is my beloved among the young men. I delight to sit in his shade, and his fruit is sweet to my taste.

4.text: He has brought me to the house of wine, and his banner over me is love.

5.text: Sustain me with raisins; refresh me with apples, for I am faint with love.

6.text: His left hand is under my head, and his right arm embraces me.

7.text: O daughters of Jerusalem, I adjure you by the gazelles and does of the field: Do not arouse or awaken love until the time is right.

8.text: Listen! My beloved approaches. Look! Here he comes, leaping across the mountains, bounding over the hills.

9.text: My beloved is like a gazelle or a young stag. Look, he stands behind our wall, gazing through the windows, peering through the lattice.

10.text: My beloved calls to me, “Arise, my darling. Come away with me, my beautiful one.

11.text: For now the winter is past; the rain is over and gone.

12.text: The flowers have appeared in the countryside; the season of singing has come, and the cooing of turtledoves is heard in our land.

13.text: The fig tree ripens its figs; the blossoming vines spread their fragrance. Arise, come away, my darling; come away with me, my beautiful one.”

14.text: O my dove in the clefts of the rock, in the crevices of the cliff, let me see your face, let me hear your voice; for your voice is sweet, and your countenance is lovely.

15.text: Catch for us the foxes—the little foxes that ruin the vineyards—for our vineyards are in bloom.

16.text: My beloved is mine and I am his; he pastures his flock among the lilies.

17.text: Before the day breaks and shadows flee, turn, my beloved, and be like a gazelle or a young stag on the mountains of Bether.
